question_sentence: Liz Cheney lost her seat in Congress this week after voters in Wyoming elected which Trump-backed Republican in the primary elections?
evidence: Cheney has been the representative for Wyoming since 2017, but lost the vote to a relative political newcomer, Harriet Hageman.

question_sentence: Which comedian’s Edinburgh Fringe show was cancelled this week due to an ‘unprecedented’ number of audience complaints?
evidence: The Guardian reported that 30 to 40 people walked out of Sadowitz’s opening show, which featured “racism, sexism, homophobia and misogyny”.

question_sentence: This week marked the first anniversary of the Taliban’s return to power in Afghanistan. How many people evacuated the country in August last year?
evidence: US troops evacuated 113,500 people from the capital Kabul, while the UK evacuated 15,000 British nationals and Afghans.

question_sentence: Beachgoers in Britain were warned against swimming in the sea this week after what happened?
choices: A shark was spotted along the Cornish coastline
Water companies dumped sewage in the sea
evidence: Surfers Against Sewage identified around 50 unsafe swimming locations which had seen sewage dumped nearby as sewer systems were overwhelmed by rainfall.

question_sentence: What might become compulsory for cyclists under rumoured new laws?
evidence: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps is calling for a review of road rules for cyclists that could make it easier for police to identify riders of two-wheeled vehicles.

question_sentence: What type of aircraft, ordered this week by American Airlines, will reduce transatlantic flights to 3hr 30min?
evidence: American Airlines bet on ultra-fast transport this week by placing an order for 20 supersonic Overture jets. It’s expected that its first passengers will board in 2029.

question_sentence: A castaway on a desert island survived for five days on a diet of which three items?
evidence: Brazilian man Nelson Nedy was rescued after a jet skier noticed him waving his T-shirt in the air on Palmas island near Rio de Janeiro.

question_sentence: Due to the rising cost of living in the US, a growing number of people are fleeing their expensive cities in search of cheaper rent and a better quality of life abroad. Where are many Americans moving?
evidence: Mexico City has become a “work from home” haven for US expats, but locals say this is pricing them out.

question_sentence: What ancient find was uncovered in a Texas riverbed this week?
evidence: Dinosaur tracks from 113 million years ago were uncovered due to severe drought conditions at Dinosaur Valley State Park.

question_sentence: Which country debuted the world’s first hydrogen-powered passenger trains this week?
evidence: Germany launched emissions-free hydrogen passenger trains, with only steam and water issuing from the exhaust.

question_sentence: A British-Belgian teenager became the youngest person to fly around the world solo in a small aircraft. How old is he?
evidence: Seventeen-year-old Mack Rutherford set a world record Wednesday after landing in the Bulgarian capital of Sofia, where his journey began on March 23. He was just 15 when he received his pilot’s license.

question_sentence: Which member of the Biden administration tested positive for Covid-19 for the second time this month?
evidence: First lady Dr. Jill Biden tested positive for a rebound case of Covid-19 on Wednesday. Biden first tested positive on August 15 while vacationing in Kiawah Island, South Carolina.

question_sentence: Apple is expected to unveil a new generation of which popular product early next month?
evidence: Apple is expected to unveil the new iPhone 14 lineup at an event on September 7.

question_sentence: President Biden on Wednesday announced new student loan relief for millions of borrowers in the US. How much loan forgiveness will some eligible borrowers receive?
evidence: Individual borrowers who make less than $125,000 yearly and married couples or heads of households who make less than $250,000 yearly and also received a Pell grant as an undergraduate student will have up to $20,000 of their student loan debt forgiven.

question_sentence: Rents in the US recently hit a record high for the 17th month in a row. Which of the following US cities saw the biggest increase compared to a year ago?
evidence: Miami, where rents were up more than 26% from a year ago, saw the biggest increase among the 50 largest US cities for the 10th-straight month. Miami was followed by New York, Boston, Chicago, and Orlando, according to the latest market data.

question_sentence: Why were some Kia and Hyundai SUVs recalled this week?
evidence: Thousands of Hyundai Palisade and Kia Telluride vehicles made between 2020 and 2022 were recalled due to fire risks. Owners of these models should park their vehicles outside and away from homes until their cars are repaired, the US Department of Transportation said on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated show brought in a whopping 10 million viewers for its first episode this week?
evidence: HBO’s “House of the Dragon” – the “Game of Thrones” prequel – brought in roughly 10 million viewers for its first episode. It is the “largest audience for any new original series in the history of HBO,” according to the network. HBO, like CNN, is part of Warner Bros. Discovery.

question_sentence: HBO’s “House of the Dragon” was the network’s most watched series premiere ever, drawing nearly how many viewers?
Which MLB team’s owner announced this week that they have "initiated a formal process" that could result in selling the franchise?
NASA shared new James Webb Telescope images that show remarkable details of which planet?
According to an AccuWeather meteorologist, which airport set its new record for hourly rainfall overnight this week?
In his new series “The End is Nye,” Bill Nye said which movie “is so painfully close to what's happening right now”?
President Joe Biden announced a plan to wipe at least $10k in debt for millions of borrowers. What type of loans will be forgiven?
A teenager spent his summer making history: He became the youngest pilot to fly solo around the world. How old is Mack Rutherford?
Which tennis star announced that they won’t play at this year’s US Open?
As a last resort option, a Missouri school district approved a policy this summer to reinstate:
Dozens of people were killed in a Russian rocket strike on Ukraine's Independence Day this week. The countries have been at war for how long?
Which of the following investors has not been linked to a potential takeover of Manchester United amid protests by fans against current owners the Glazer family?
choices: Investor and Spurs owner Joe Lewis
Former Goldman Sachs executive Jim O’Neill
evidence: Around 10,000 Man Utd fans joined a march on Old Trafford this week to protest against the Florida-based Glazer family, who have saddled the club with huge debt

question_sentence: Student nurse Owami Davies was found after a seven-week search by Metropolitan Police during which officers received how many reported sightings?
evidence: Police said 24-year-old Davies appeared to be in ‘good health’ and was in ‘a place of safety’ after being found in Hampshire following a tip-off from a member of the public

question_sentence: Who was the star guest on the first episode of Meghan Markle’s newly launched Spotify podcast Archetypes?
evidence: Prince Harry also made a surprise cameo on the poorly reviewed debut episode, which focused on societal attitudes to female ambition

question_sentence: Criminal barristers protesting against cuts to pay and legal aid have voted to strike indefinitely from when?
evidence: The walkout is timed to coincide with the announcement of the new Tory leader and will result in the majority of crown court trials being adjourned in England and Wales

question_sentence: Which social media platform was the No.1 non-gaming app in the US Apple App Store this week after overtaking rivals including Facebook and Instagram?
evidence: The simultaneous photo-sharing app is designed to offer authentic snapshots of users’ daily lives and has been taking Gen Z by storm

question_sentence: China has announced plans to save drought-ravaged grain harvests by generating rain through a controversial technique called what?
evidence: The  weather modification technique involves spraying chemicals into clouds to induce rainfall. Beijing did not offer details about where and exactly how this might be done

question_sentence: Ukrainians this week celebrated Independence Day, which marks the date that the country officially split from the Soviet Union in which year?
evidence: Large-scale Independence Day celebrations were banned this year amid fears of further attacks by invading Russia forces. Instead, captured Russian military vehicles and tanks were paraded through Kyiv

question_sentence: Who has veteran broadcaster Emily Maitlis described as an ‘active Tory party agent’ at the BBC?
evidence: In a speech at the Edinburgh TV Festival, former Newsnight presenter Maitlis said BBC board member Gibb, who was Theresa May’s director of communications, was shaping the broadcaster’s output by acting as ‘the arbiter of BBC impartiality’

question_sentence: Elton John has collaborated with which US popstar on his new single, Hold Me Closer?
evidence: The song marks Spears’ return to music after winning her legal battle to be freed from her controversial conservatorship

question_sentence: This week’s GCSE results day revealed that pass grades have fallen from 79% last year to how much?
evidence: Although the pass rate fell from 2021, this year’s rate is up from 70% in 2019, when secondary school students in the UK last sat formal exams
